rows.title: Praise yourself

transcript.eng:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: “This week, I am proud of myself for …” It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!

rows.transcript:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: “This week, I am proud of myself for …” It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!

text_1.eng: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!

rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about praise.

Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!

media_title.eng: How will praise help you and your family? Tap play to find out!

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about praise.

Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
rows.media_title: How will praise help you and your family? Tap play to find out!
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Praise is an easy way to build your teen’s confidence and strengthen your connection. It really works!

media_title.eng: Praise works, but it’s not always easy. Hear how @data.characters.media_female_2.name started using it at home

media_transcript.eng:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Praise is an easy way to build your teen’s confidence and strengthen your connection. It really works!
rows.media_title: Praise works, but it’s not always easy. Hear how @data.characters.media_female_2.name started using it at home
rows.media_transcript:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, “We were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?” But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said “Thank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.” My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on our own experience with praise.

quiz_1_question.eng:
Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.

How did it make you feel?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: We sometimes have to get used to being praised and praising others. That’s okay.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That’s great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.

quiz_2_question.eng:
Parents usually do not get thanked or praised enough.

How does it make you feel when nobody says "thank you"?

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Your teen can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: We sometimes have to get used to being praised and praising others. That’s okay.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That’s great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.

How did it make you feel?

text_1_facilitator.eng: Just like we feel better when praised, teens do too. Let’s look at a simple example with @data.characters.f1_father.name and his son, @data.characters.f1_son_14.name.

character_1_text.eng: Thank you for doing the dishes, @data.characters.f1_son_14.name. It's a big help!

character_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_father_role.name, I hate doing the dishes every day. It is women’s work! @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name or @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name should be doing them. Even my book at school only shows women doing the dishes.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Just like we feel better when praised, teens do too. Let’s look at a simple example with @data.characters.f1_father.name and his son, @data.characters.f1_son_14.name.
rows.character_1_text: Thank you for doing the dishes, @data.characters.f1_son_14.name. It's a big help!
rows.character_2_text: @data.characters.f1_father_role.name, I hate doing the dishes every day. It is women’s work! @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name or @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name should be doing them. Even my book at school only shows women doing the dishes.

character_1_text.eng: It is not women’s work. @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name  are busy at work and school all day as well. We all need to play our part at home too.

rows.character_1_text: It is not women’s work. @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name  are busy at work and school all day as well. We all need to play our part at home too.

character_1_text.eng:
I know it's hard to understand, but it's important that we all work together. Doing this kind of work will help you become an independent and responsible man when you have your own family. 

I am proud of you for doing your part. Here, let me help you dry the dishes.

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: It made @data.characters.f1_son_14.name feel seen and appreciated

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! Praise helps teens feel valued, and they are more likely to help again.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: It helped @data.characters.f1_son_14.name feel respected and more willing to help again

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Exactly! Praise helps teens feel valued, and they are more likely to help again.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: It made @data.characters.f1_son_14.name feel more connected to his father

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Exactly! Praise helps teens feel valued, and they are more likely to help again.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Exactly! Praise helps teens feel valued, and they are more likely to help again.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Exactly! Praise helps teens feel valued, and they are more likely to help again.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Exactly! Praise helps teens feel valued, and they are more likely to help again.

rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: It helped @data.characters.f1_son_14.name feel respected and more willing to help again
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: It made @data.characters.f1_son_14.name feel more connected to his father
rows.character_1_text:
I know it's hard to understand, but it's important that we all work together. Doing this kind of work will help you become an independent and responsible man when you have your own family. 

I am proud of you for doing your part. Here, let me help you dry the dishes.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Here are some skills to help you praise your teens.
You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!

section_1_text.eng: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you will see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.

section_2_text.eng: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!

section_3_text.eng: Try to find something to thank your boys and girls for every day. Even something really small.

section_3_extra_text.eng: Remember, teens respond best to positive attention. When they feel noticed and appreciated at home, they are less likely to take risks to earn approval from others.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Here are some skills to help you praise your teens.
You can also praise other adults in your household, too. Notice how they respond!
rows.section_1_text: Look for anything your teen does that is helpful or good and praise them for it. They may not show it, but you will see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
rows.section_2_text: Be enthusiastic – really mean it when you say it!
rows.section_3_text: Try to find something to thank your boys and girls for every day. Even something really small.
rows.section_3_extra_text: Remember, teens respond best to positive attention. When they feel noticed and appreciated at home, they are less likely to take risks to earn approval from others.

text_1_facilitator.eng: It can be hard to think of reasons to praise your teen! Here are some ideas from other parents:

text_2.eng:
**Thank you for...**
- Being kind to someone
- Cleaning your room
- Joining a family meal
- Greeting other family members
- Looking after your siblings
- Coming home on time
- Showing thoughtfulness
- Saying 'please' or 'thank you'
- Going to school on time
- Doing chores or schoolwork

rows.text_1_facilitator: It can be hard to think of reasons to praise your teen! Here are some ideas from other parents:
rows.text_2:
**Thank you for...**
- Being kind to someone
- Cleaning your room
- Joining a family meal
- Greeting other family members
- Looking after your siblings
- Coming home on time
- Showing thoughtfulness
- Saying 'please' or 'thank you'
- Going to school on time
- Doing chores or schoolwork

text_1_facilitator.eng: This week’s home activity is to praise your teen once a day. It only takes a few seconds.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you praise your teen once a day this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Parents who practise praise at home get better results!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Try praising your teen for something simple at first, like looking after their siblings or going to school.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. With time, giving praise will become easier. Try to praise yourself for something first, like "Good job using @global.app_name. It shows you care."

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Parents who practise praise at home get better results!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: You can do it! Try praising your teen for something simple at first, like looking after their siblings or going to school.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. With time, giving praise will become easier. Try to praise yourself for something first, like "Good job using @global.app_name. It shows you care."
rows.quiz_1_question: Can you praise your teen once a day this week?
rows.text_1_facilitator: This week’s home activity is to praise your teen once a day. It only takes a few seconds.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Remember, praise is a powerful tool. The more attention you give to positive behaviour, the more positive behaviour you will see.

media_title.eng: Hear from @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name on how it feels to get praise from her mother

media_transcript.eng:
I was grateful when my mother learned about praise.

Before the workshop, she mostly noticed when I did something wrong. She would shout and sometimes hit me.

But after the workshop, she began praising me for small things — even things she never noticed before, like my good maths grades. At first I thought, ‘What is going on?’ But she kept doing it. I liked it, so I started doing more good things.

It feels good that my mother now sees the good in me, not only the bad.

One day during one-on-one time, I told her, ‘Thank you, Mama, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.’ It made both of us very happy.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Remember, praise is a powerful tool. The more attention you give to positive behaviour, the more positive behaviour you will see.
rows.media_title: Hear from @data.characters.media_daughter_2.name on how it feels to get praise from her mother
rows.media_transcript:
I was grateful when my mother learned about praise.

Before the workshop, she mostly noticed when I did something wrong. She would shout and sometimes hit me.

But after the workshop, she began praising me for small things — even things she never noticed before, like my good maths grades. At first I thought, ‘What is going on?’ But she kept doing it. I liked it, so I started doing more good things.

It feels good that my mother now sees the good in me, not only the bad.

One day during one-on-one time, I told her, ‘Thank you, Mama, for saying something nice when I do things well, not only when I do things wrong.’ It made both of us very happy.
